attributes.action: Bestow knighthoods on the remaining WW1 veterans - Harry Patch and Henry Allingham
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Henry Allingham and Harry Patch are the last the veterans of World War One. The honours system exists to reward chilavry and their sacrifice, and the sacrifices countless others of that generation, should be recognised with knighthoods. This would be a fitting award in each of their cases. They both saw active service in the Great War and this country owes them a great debt.

rejection.details:
The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.honours.gov.uk/

Kind Regards

E-Petitions
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
